snippet: The Economics Ministry described the Bankia intervention as "a first step to guarantee its solvency," suggesting that it would follow up with a capital injection.
abstract: Spain is expected to announce measures to strengthen its banking sector, two days after seizing control of Bankia, the nation's largest real estate lender; analysts anticipate that the government will require banks to set aside at least 30 billion euros more against bad loans.
lead_paragraph: The Economics Ministry described the Bankia intervention as "a first step to guarantee its solvency," suggesting that it would follow up with a capital injection.

headline.main: Spain Is Likely to Take Steps to Strengthen Its Banking System
headline.print_headline: Spain Is Likely to Take Steps to Strengthen Its Banking System
